lead_paragraph: THE California Board of Education last week sought to settle a noisy dispute over how best to teach math to the state's 5.5 million public schoolchildren. The board approved a set of standards for students in each grade, emphasizing memorization and basic computational skills over the ability to solve and explain analytical word problems, a method of instruction that has grown in popularity in recent years.
abstract: Comment on polarized, ideological debates over education theory, such as current one in California on teaching of mathematics; observes that stark 'either-or' arguments ignore classroom reality, which is that teachers routinely employ many approaches to encourage learning; photos (M)

headline.main: Class Wars; Clashing Over Education's One True Faith
